data.title: 'Beautiful Girls' Cast: Where Are They Now?
data.meta_description: 'Beautiful Girls' hit theaters in 1996, featuring a star-studded cast like Timothy Hutton, Matt Dillon, Natalie Portman, Uma Thurman and more. See what the group of on-screen friends have been up to since their 10-year high school reunion.
data.text:
On Feb. 9, 1996, the dramedy Beautiful Girls first opened in theaters. The film centers around Willie (Timothy Hutton), who returns home for his high school reunion in a small Massachusetts town. It's funny and heartwarming and features one of the better ensemble casts of the 1990s. Head back down memory lane and see what the actors have been up since the film's release.

Timothy Hutton as Willie Conway

Years before his character, Willie, revisited his old stomping grounds in the fictional town of Knight's Ridge, Hutton won Best Supporting Actor in 1981 for his performance in Ordinary People. At only 20 years old, he became (and has remained) the youngest male actor to win an Oscar. It's no surprise the star continued to prove his dramatic chops in the decades since playing everyone's favorite sideburn-sporting jazz pianist.

Hutton has been featured in films like The General's Daughter (1999), Kinsey (2004), The Good Shepherd (2006), Serious Moonlight (2009), Beautiful Boy (2018) and The Glorias (2020) with Julianne Moore and Alicia Vikander.

No stranger to the small screen, the actor led A&E's detective series, A Nero Wolfe Mystery, directed several episodes and served as an executive producer. He then starred on Leverage and American Crime opposite Felicity Huffman, which earned him an Emmy nomination in 2015. Other notable TV credits include Tom Clancy's Jack Ryan, The Haunting of Hill House, How to Get Away With Murder, Almost Family and Women of the Movement.

In 2020, he was accused of sexually assaulting then-14-year-old model Sera Johnston in a hotel room in 1983. Hutton denied the allegations; In 2021, he was officially cleared of all charges by the British Columbia Crown Counsel and the Vancouver Police Department.

Hutton and his now-estranged wife, Aurore Giscard d'Estaing – an illustrator and the niece of former French president Valery Giscard d'Estaing – tied the knot in 2000. Their son Milo was born the following year. He also shares a son, Noah, with ex-wife and actress Debra Winger, whom he was married to from 1986 to 1990.

Matt Dillon as Tommy "Birdman" Rowland

After playing Tommy "Birdman" Rowland — the former jock who never met his full potential — Matt Dillon was featured in a string of '90s hits: In & Out (1997), There's Something About Mary (1998) and Wild Things (1998).

He continued acting throughout the 2000s, starring in Crash (2004), Factotum (2005), You, Me and Dupree (2006), Nothing but the Truth (2008), Takers (2010), Girl Most Likely (2012), Bad Country (2014) and Asteroid City (2023).

In 2018, he led the cast of The House That Jack Built alongside his Beautiful Girls costar, Uma Thurman, and the gruesome flick made headlines when it prompted over 100 walkouts at Cannes. For his role as bigoted police officer John Ryan in Crash, Dillon received an Oscar nomination in 2006 for Best Supporting Actor.

The actor also tried his hand at TV, starring on the Fox series Wayward Pines in 2015. He will appear opposite Patricia Arquette on the Apple TV+ show High Desert, premiering on May 17, 2023.

Dillon is in a relationship with longtime girlfriend and Italian actress Roberta Mastromichele.

Natalie Portman as Marty

Natalie Portman was only 15 when she played the girl next door who nurses a crush on Willie. Since then, Portman has starred in the Star Wars prequels, Garden State (2004), Closer (2004), V for Vendetta (2005), The Other Boleyn Girl (2008), Brothers (2009) and Black Swan (2010), which earned her an Oscar for Best Actress.

Portman was also featured in No Strings Attached (2011), Jackie (2016), Annihilation (2018) and Lucy in The Sky (2019). Her performance as Jacqueline Kennedy in the 2016 biopic earned Portman her third Oscar nomination. She joined the Marvel Cinematic Universe, portraying superhero Jane Foster in three Thor installments, including The Dark World (2013) and Love and Thunder (2022).

The actress is an animal rights advocate and has a long history of supporting anti-poverty organizations like FINCA International. She contributed $50,000 to the Time's Up initiative in 2018. As captured in a video by CNN, Portman opened up about the sexual trauma she experienced as a 13-year-old on the set of her first film, Léon: The Professional (1994).

Portman has been married to Benjamin Millepied since August 2012; the two first met on the set of Black Swan in 2009 and started dating. Portman and Millepied share two children: son Aleph and daughter Amalia.

Lauren Holly as Darian Smalls

Lauren Holly's role as Darian Smalls saw her as Tommy's former high school sweetheart, who needed to remind Kev that it was, in fact, five o'clock in the morning. The actress was later featured in Any Given Sunday (1999), What Women Want (2000), Field of Lost Shoes (2015), The Blackcoat's Daughter (2015) and several TV and holiday movies.

Holly never strayed far from the crime scene or courtroom on the small screen. She starred on NCIS as Director Jenny Shepard and played the lead medical examiner on the Canadian procedural Motive. Since then, she's appeared on other series such as Designated Survivor, Tiny Pretty Things, The Lake and Family Law.

Holly shares three sons — Alexander, George and Henry — with ex-husband Francis Greco. She was previously married to actor and comedian Jim Carrey from 1996 to 1997.

Rosie O'Donnell as Gina Barrisano

Though Rosie O'Donnell would continue to star in films after Beautiful Girls — including Harriet the Spy (1996) and Tarzan (1999) — she focused her career on daytime and primetime TV.

She began her new chapter in 1996 with The Rosie O'Donnell Show, which won 11 Daytime Emmys for outstanding talk show. The comedian followed six seasons of The Rosie O'Donnell Show with a stint on The View in 2006 (where she famously feuded with Donald Trump), the short-lived Rosie Radio on SiriusXM and OWN's The Rosie Show.

O'Donnell was later cast as Rita Hendricks on ABC Family's The Fosters, made a cameo in Pitch Perfect 2 (2015) and popped up on an episode of Empire. She even appeared on two episodes of the CBS sitcom Mom as Allison Janney's character's ex-girlfriend.

The actress garnered critical acclaim for her role as Tutu on Showtime's SMILF and appeared on American Gigolo as Detective Joan Sunday and The L Word: Generation Q. In 2022, she joined the cast of Prime Video's A League of Their Own reboot as Vi, the owner of an underground gay bar. O'Donnell also voiced the subway announcer throughout season 2 of Russian Doll.

She is an outspoken advocate for LGBTQ and adoption rights, and in 2003, she co-created Rosie's Theater Kids, a charity that aims to provide free music and dance education to New York City public school students.

O'Donnell has five children: Parker, Chelsea, Blake, Vivienne and Dakota. She was married to Nickelodeon executive Kelli Carpenter until 2004 and wed her second wife, Michelle Rounds, in 2012. The two finalized their divorce in March 2016 before Rounds died of apparent suicide in 2017.

Mira Sorvino as Sharon Cassidy

Naturally, Hutton and Portman aren't the only ones in the cast with an Oscar. Mira Sorvino, who played Tommy's girlfriend, Sharon, won a Best Supporting Actress Oscar in 1996 for her role in Woody Allen's Mighty Aphrodite, the same year Beautiful Girls was released.

Sorvino went on to star opposite Lisa Kudrow in the '90s cult classic Romy and Michele's High School Reunion (1997), followed by the 1999 flicks At First Sight and Spike Lee's Summer of Sam. Sorvino also had supporting roles in Reservation Road (2007), Space Warriors (2013), Stuber (2019) and Sound of Freedom (2022).

Over the years, Sorvino has appeared on TV favorites like Intruders, StartUp, Modern Family, Hollywood, The Expecting, Impeachment: American Crime Story and Shining Vale. She earned an Emmy nomination in 1996 for her performance as Marilyn Monroe in the biopic Norma Jean & Marilyn.

Off-screen, Sorvino is an anti-human trafficking activist and, in 2009, was appointed United Nations Goodwill ambassador. The actress has been involved with Amnesty International since 2004.

Sorvino has been married to actor Christopher Backus since 2004. Together, they share four children — Mattea, Johnny, Holden and Lucia. Sorvino is the daughter of late Goodfellas and Law & Order star Paul Sorvino, who died on July 25, 2022, at 83.

Uma Thurman as Andera

Beautiful Girls was Thurman's third feature film after starring in 1994's Pulp Fiction — for which she was nominated Best Supporting Actress — and 1995's A Month By the Lake. In the following years, she was cast in The Truth About Cats and Dogs (1996), Batman & Robin (1997) and Gattaca (1997), where she met actor Ethan Hawke, whom she married in 1998 before filing for divorce in 2004. Since then, she's built a lengthy résumé and solidified her status as a Hollywood icon.

Thurman was featured in the HBO adaptation Hysterical Blindness in 2002, winning her first Golden Globe. The model-turned-actress would go on to team up with Quentin Tarantino as the deadly leading woman in the Kill Bill movie franchise, where she earned two back-to-back Golden Globe nominations in 2004 and 2005.

Beyond Kill Bill, Thurman's other film credits include Paycheck (2003), Be Cool (2005), The Producers (2005), My Super Ex-Girlfriend (2006), Motherhood (2009), The War with Grandpa (2020), Hollywood Stargirl (2022) and the Nymphomaniac film series. The actress is set to appear in the 2023 comedy thriller The Kill Room opposite former Pulp Fiction costar Samuel L. Jackson and her daughter, Stranger Things actress Maya Hawke.

Thurman received an Emmy nomination for her guest starring role on Smash in 2012 and made her Broadway debut in The Parisian Woman in 2017. She has also had recurring roles on shows like The Slap, Imposters, Chambers, Suspicion and Super Pumped. Off-screen, Thurman advocates for gun control and LGBTQ and animal rights.

In addition to daughter Maya, Thurman shares son Levon with ex-husband Hawke. She welcomed her second daughter, Luna (her full name is Rosalind Arusha Arkadina Altalune Florence Thurman-Busson), in July 2012 with ex-fiancé and French businessman Arpad Busson.

Martha Plimpton as Jan

The Goonies' Martha Plimpton was all grown up when she played Jan in 1996. In the years after Beautiful Girls, the actress appeared in flicks like Pecker (1998), 200 Cigarettes (1999), Company (2011) and Mass (2021).

Plimpton is known for her starring role on Fox's Raising Hope, which earned her an Emmy nomination in 2011 for outstanding lead actress. She also won an Emmy in 2012 for her guest appearance as Patti Nyholm on The Good Wife. Other notable TV credits include The Real O'Neals, Generation, Sprung and A Town Called Malice.

The actress is a veteran of the stage, too. She's appeared on Broadway in The Coast of Utopia, Top Girls and Pal Joey, all of which earned her Tony Award nominations.

Plimpton is a lifelong advocate for abortion rights. She co-founded and is on the board of directors for the nonprofit organization A Is For, which provides essential information and support for abortion-seekers and service providers.

She famously dated late actor River Phoenix in the '80s, with the two attending the Academy Awards together in 1989.

Michael Rapaport as Paul Kirkwood

As no-nonsense Paul, Michael Rapaport was responsible for the quote that gave a nod to the film's title: "A beautiful girl is all-powerful, and that's as good as love."

Following Beautiful Girls, Rapaport has had roles in Deep Blue Sea (1999), The 6th Day (2000), Dr. Dolittle 2 (2001), 29 Palms (2002), Hitch (2005), The Heat (2013) and Sully (2016). He also starred on three seasons of Boston Public and on season 4 of Prison Break as Homeland Security agent Don Self. Rapaport's other TV credits include The War at Home, My Name Is Earl, The Mob Doctor, Justified, Public Morals, White Famous, Atypical, Only Murders in the Building and Life & Beth.

Since 2014, Rapaport has hosted I Am Rapaport Stereo Podcast, where he shares his spicy takes on life, sports, music and film. The self-proclaimed sports fanatic penned This Book Has Balls in 2017, sharing his rants and unpopular opinions on athletes and teams.

The actor married actress Kebe Dunn in 2016. Rapaport shares two sons, Julian Ali and Maceo Shane, with ex-wife and producer Nichole Beattie.

Annabeth Gish as Tracy Stover

Annabeth Gish played Tracy, Willie's longtime New York City girlfriend. Following Beautiful Girls, Gish appeared in Double Jeopardy (1999), The Celestine Prophecy (2006), Term Life (2016), Gone Mom (2021), Butter (2022) and Little Dixie (2023). She is also known for her roles as Eileen Caffee on Showtime's Brotherhood, Special Agent Monica Reyes on The X-Files and wealthy widow Charlotte Millwright on FX's The Bridge. Gish has had recurring roles on Sons of Anarchy, Pretty Little Liars, Halt and Catch Fire, The Haunting of Hill House, Midnight Mass and Mayfair Witches.

The actress supports the humanitarian and emergency relief agency CARE International and Students Rebuild program, which encourages students and teachers to participate in collective action through art and philanthropy.

In 2003, Gish married Wade Allen, a stuntman she met on the set of The X-Files. They have two children, Cash Alexander and Enzo Edward.
